com.epoch.utils

Class CharReencoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.epoch.utils.CharReencoder

  • class CharReencoder
extends Object
    Methods for interconverting UTF-8 and Latin-1 characters, character entity references, and UCS-2 characters.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private StringBuilder bld
      Contains the growing converted string.
      private String s
      String to be reencoded, converting non-ASCII characters to character entity references or character entity references to UCS-2 characters.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description
      CharReencoder(String str)
      Constructor.

      Converts an array of bytes representing text in the UTF-8 encoding method into a string containing UCS-2 (Unicode) characters.

      Capitalizes the first letter of the string, even if accented.

      Converts character entity references, including accented characters, to characters appropriate for alphabetization.

      private static void debugPrint(Object... msg) 
      (package private) static RuleBasedCollator getCollator(String language)
      Returns a collator for a particular location based on a language, modifying the default (incorrect) behavior to place spaces before other characters; ref: http://jan.baresovi.cz/dr/en/java-collator-spaces

      Converts a string inputted by a user from UTF-8 encoding to character entity references.

    • Method Detail

      • debugPrint

        private static void debugPrint(Object... msg)

      • bytesToUnicodeString

        static String bytesToUnicodeString(byte[] bts)
        Converts an array of bytes representing text in the UTF-8 encoding method into a string containing UCS-2 (Unicode) characters.
        Parameters:
        bts - array of bytes
        Returns:
        a Unicode-containing String

      • inputToUnicode

        String inputToUnicode()
        Converts a string inputted by a user from UTF-8 encoding to UCS-2 (Unicode) characters. We assume that the front end has collected any input in UTF-8 format, not Latin-1 or MS-1252; forms acquiring such input should include the attribute,
        accept-charset="UTF-8"
        and the action page should contain the line,
        request.setCharacterEncoding("UTF-8");
        Returns:
        the converted String

      • unicodeToCERs

        String unicodeToCERs()
        Converts non-ASCII UCS-2 characters in a string into the corresponding character entity references.
        Returns:
        string with only ASCII characters and CERs

      • inputToCERs

        String inputToCERs()
        Converts a string inputted by a user from UTF-8 encoding to character entity references. We assume that the front end has collected any input in UTF-8 format, not Latin-1 or MS-1252; forms acquiring such input should include the attribute,
        accept-charset="UTF-8"
        and the action page should contain the line,
        request.setCharacterEncoding("UTF-8");
        Returns:
        the converted String

      • cersToUnicode

        String cersToUnicode()
        Convert character entity references in a string into a proper Unicode string understood by Java (which is in UCS-2).
        Returns:
        same contents encoded in UCS-2 (Java internal representation)

      • urisToText

        String urisToText()
        Converts a string encoded by Javascript's encodeURIComponent() into regular characters.
        Returns:
        string with decoded special characters

      • getCollator

        static RuleBasedCollator getCollator(String language)
        Returns a collator for a particular location based on a language, modifying the default (incorrect) behavior to place spaces before other characters; ref: http://jan.baresovi.cz/dr/en/java-collator-spaces
        Parameters:
        language - the language
        Returns:
        a collator based on the language's location, modified to have spaces sort before characters

      • realphabetize

        static boolean realphabetize(String language)
        Determines whether the language follows different alphabetization rules from English.
        Parameters:
        language - the language
        Returns:
        true if the language follows different alphabetization rules from English

      • capitalize

        String capitalize()
        Capitalizes the first letter of the string, even if accented.
        Returns:
        string with first letter capitalized

      • cersToAlphabetical

        String cersToAlphabetical()
        Converts character entity references, including accented characters, to characters appropriate for alphabetization. Called by UserWrite to make sort keys of names for Oracle.
        Returns:
        modified String

      • unicodeToAccentless

        String unicodeToAccentless()
        Converts accented Unicode letters to accentless ones. Called by SortIgnoreCase.
        Returns:
        modified String

      • removeCharAccent

        private String removeCharAccent(int num)
        Converts character entity references for accented letters to accentless letters.
        Parameters:
        num - the Unicode number of the CER
        Returns:
        the corresponding accentless character, or empty string if the character is not an accented letter
